Talon

"So are we moving To Lord Elder"said soflty Talon"What about that de=
cepticon named Megatron, and what about Rodimus and Nightlight"




From: K=
raftlos 
Sent: Sunday, May 10, 2009 10:36 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Su=
bject: Re: The Crash Landing and Aftermath





Salveo landed their last re=
maining shuttle atop the metal slab that
once was the Maximal Base. The car=
go ramp lowered and the crew walked
out into the scene of the disaster. The=
y were greeted by Lord Perseus
who stopped digging through debris to fill t=
hem in on what happened.

"Right before the tidal wave hit, we saw a massiv=
e ship fly overhead,
not 300m above us." he said. "Something that massive f=
alling from
orbit could easily explain the force of the water."

"How's the=
 rest of the city," asked Salveo.

"Not good. Most the people escaped to th=
eir shelters, however the
buildings were all destroyed. Except the tower an=
d several on the far
side of the island."

"The shuttles?"

"Ours was destr=
oyed, a few were in the air when the wave hit."

"I dont think we can rebui=
ld this." said Salveo after a moment of
looking at the devistation.

"I thi=
nk its possible, but unwise. I think this gives us a new
opportunity to rej=
oin our Maximal allies and pool our resources. So
for the moment, we should=
 recover what we can and put it into the
shuttle, then assist Atlantis in a=
nyway possible."

"Rejoin Lord Elder? Will that work? And what about Atlant=
is?"

"Atlantis will be safe from the Unicronians; they wont bother with a
=
few hundred scientists and fisherman. What they want is to destroy
us, and =
they will follow us wherever we decide to have our base. As
for that crashe=
d ship, I dont think its wise to mount a expedition
while the city lies in =
ruin and we remain baseless."

"Right, so priority one, help the city and r=
ecover what we can from
our base." replied Salveo.

"Correct."

On 4/30/09,=
 airly2002@... <airly2002@...> wrote:

>
>

nodded and Followed Lord Elder.
>
>
> Kup.
>

till regrets to leave Roddy, windlord and
> Nightlight behind
>
>
>
>
>
> F=
rom: Kraftlos

ps.com

>
>
>
>
>
> Lord Pers=
eus opened the door to the lower level of the base, and water
> poured into=
 the room. He motioned for everyone to follow.
>
> "It looks like that ship=
 we saw crash landed in the ocean..." he said
> mater of factly. "Look at t=
his place."
>
> What had once been their base was now a slab of concrete an=
d metal
> with the ocasional structural support poking up from the foundati=
on.
> The city, in just as bad of shape, was errily flat with a large numbe=
r
> of buildings simply washed away.
>
> "Looks like we need a new base." s=
aid Guardia steping quietly behind
> Lord Perseus, sloshing water with each=
 step.
>
> "This base was build from an old hanger, it wasnt intended to ta=
ke
> that kind of punishment. We could rebuild here, or we could find a
> b=
etter location. First we need to make sure the townsfolk are ok;
> I'll try=
 to signal Salveo's team, we're going to need that shuttle."
>
> Meanwhile.=
..
>
> Celeron lept up from his chair to stair at some strange radar
> read=
ings. An entire sector on the map had temporarily darkened, then
> went cle=
ar again. The mass that represnted Atlantis didnt look right.
> He knew it =
had changed in the last minion attack; but this didnt even
> look like the =
same city anymore.
>
> "Blast... looks like we need to go see what's going =
on." said Celeron
> to himself. "Predecons! Report!"
>
> OOC: This would be=
 the Iron Skull predecon base,
>
> Meanwhile...
>
> Salveo walked into the =
room where Lord Elder was working.
>
> "Atlantis was just devastated by a t=
idal wave. We're going to have to
> go back there and assist them.; our bas=
e was destroyed."
>

com> wrote:

>> The engines had been losing power for the last day and a half=
; but finally
>> the gigantic craft could no longer fight the forces that p=
ulled on it and
>> its orbit began to decay. Knowing that their only hope o=
f survival was to
>> safely crash land, the pilot picked an open area of oc=
ean and tried to
>> approach at a safe angle to slow itself enough to keep =
the ship intact.
>>
>> Lord Perseus and his crew walked along the bridge th=
at crossed the gap
>> between the part of the island where the hangers were=
 located and the
>> peninsula area where the base sat. Suddenly the sky bec=
ame dark and a
>> rumbling noise could be heard, growing louder and louder.=
 He looked up to
>> see almost the whole sky occupied by a massive starship=
 seemly heading
>> straight for the island. The Atlantis emergency alarm st=
arted to sound and
>> civilians rushed to their shelters.
>>
>> "Everyone! =
To the base! Hurry!" ordered Perseus breaking out into a run.
>>
>> The rum=
bling sound continued to get louder. As Perseus and his crew
>> reached
>> =
the base door, it was quickly opened for them then shut behind them. He
>> =
ordered everyone to move the lower level of the base. As the ship passed
>>=
 over the island, the sound grew so loud that the ground shook and weaker
>=
> parts of buildings started to crumble, as in an earthquake. The ship
>> t=
raveled for another three miles before it touched down in the deep ocean
>>=
 waters. The force of the impact sent the ship hundreds of feet below the
>=
> surface and it continued to sink until coming to rest on the top of an
>>=
 underwater mountain. The mass of water displaced by the ship started a
>> =
massive tsunami-like wave, going out in all directions.
>>
>> The ground be=
gan to shake again and the lights flickered inside the
>> Maximal
>> base.
=
>>
>> "Sir, what's that noise?" Guardia asked, sealing the last heavy door =
to
>> the
>> underground section of the base.
>>
>> The lights continued to=
 flicker, then went out.
>>
>> At that moment the ten-story-high wall of wa=
ter struck Atlantis from the
>> east, picking up all the boats in the harbo=
r and tossing them onto the
>> land.
>> The parts of the docks that were no=
t made of concrete were pushed up and
>> destroyed. A moment later the wate=
r hit the buildings in the lower wharf
>> area and they immediately collaps=
ed under the intense weight of water.
>> Likewise the metal dome that made =
up the upper story of the Maximal base
>> was
>> immediately ripped from it=
s foundations and carried away, along with
>> everything in the command cen=
ter, the armory, mess hall, and the main bank
>> of CR chambers were also p=
icked up and carried away.
>>
>> The lower floor of the base had a large me=
tal slab to protect it from
>> bombing, and as the water continued to pour =
over it, everything on the
>> upper
>> floors was ripped away, leaving a cl=
ean plate of metal sitting at the
>> bottom
>> of the crater that was the b=
ase. The buildings along the center of the
>> town
>> were a little sturdie=
r and remained standing, though heavily damaged. The
>> hanger and all the =
craft in it were picked up and thrown into the ocean.
>>
>> As the water ca=
me to tower it filled up the deep trench around the
>> structure
>> then th=
e wall hit it, wrapping it entirely except for the top five
>> stories,
>> =
damaging supports, breaking out all the windows and destroying the bridges
=
>> that allowed access to the tower. The wave then continued across the res=
t
>> of the island, destroying buildings and carrying away the mass of debr=
is,
>> and then all was eerily quiet.
>>
>>
